###PROBABILITY GENERATING FUNCTIONS:
<br>

One of the four ways of getting moments (together with direct calculation of $\mathbb E[X^n]$; MGF's; and characteristic function).

To directly find $\mathbb E[X^n]$ we need to calculate $\displaystyle \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} x f(x)dx.$

Probability generating functions only work for discrete distributions.

The equation is:

$$G(z) = \mathbb E[z^X]= \displaystyle \sum_{x=0}^\infty p(x)\, z^x$$
